clinical_study.brief_title: An Evaluation of Healthy Marriage and Relationship Education Program: Elevate
clinical_study.official_title: Elevate: Taking Your Relationship to the Next Level

collaborator.agency: Department of Health and Human Services

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the healthy marriage and relationship education program Elevate: Taking Your Relationship to the Next Level results in improved couple, parenting, and co-parenting behaviors that lead to reduced child abuse/neglect potential.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study is based on the theory that couples can learn skills through participating in the Elevate curriculum that will help them function better as a couple resulting in improved relationship quality/stability, improved co-parenting skills, improved financial management, and reduced financial stress. As a result of improved relationship skills and better management of stress, couples will then provide more supportive, safe, and stable family environments for children.
Individuals who are eligible (biological parents of children 0-18 who were removed from their home and were recently re-unified) and agree to participate in the study are randomly assigned to a treatment group or a control group. Both groups receive a needs assessment and referral to appropriate agencies to address their needs. Treatment group participants will participate in the Elevate intervention (8 hours of classes over a 4-week period). Individuals in the control group do not participate in the intervention but are wait-listed and eligible to participate in Elevate after they complete the study (12 months).
The impact study of Elevate will examine whether participation in the study improves couple functioning and parenting skills and decreases instances of child abuse/neglect. Members of both the treatment and control groups are surveyed three times. The surveys include items related to couple functioning behaviors, relationship quality/stability, parenting/co-parenting skills, and financial management and distress. At the end of 12 months, Georgia's Department of Family and Children Services (DFCS) will provide information on whether or not the families (in both the treatment and control groups) have had any substantiated reports of child abuse or neglect. The impact of Elevate will be measured by whether or not families have substantiated reports of child abuse/neglect and thereby re-enter the DFCS system.

primary_outcome.measure: Georgia Division of Family and Children Services reported incidents of substantiated child abuse/neglect during 12 months RCT families participated in the study.
primary_outcome.description: DFCS data on study families' incidents of reported child abuse/neglect will be used to determine impact of the Elevate program to reduce child abuse/neglect. The number of substantiated reports of abuse/neglect for treatment families will be compared to the number for control families.

secondary_outcome.measure: Elevate Pre-post program survey subscale measuring change in couple functioning and stability
secondary_outcome.description: Study participant responses on Elevate pre-post survey subscale measuring change in couple functioning behaviors, including communication, conflict resolution, commitment, and supportive behaviors will be compared between treatment and control groups to determine impact of Elevate on positive couple functioning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Elevate Pre-post program survey subscale measuring change in parenting skills
secondary_outcome.description: Study participant responses on Elevate pre-post survey subscale measuring change in parenting skill level, including interactions with children, co-parenting approaches, and beliefs about appropriate parenting behaviors, will be compared between treatment and control groups to determine impact of Elevate on positive behaviors and beliefs associated with positive parenting.

arm_group.description: Treatment study participants receive needs assessment and 8 hours of classes over a 4-week period in healthy couple functioning behaviors, relationship quality/stability, and parenting skills.
Control study participants receive needs assessment and are wait listed to receive Elevate

intervention.description: Study participants receive needs assessment and 8 hours of classes over a 4-week period in healthy couple functioning behaviors, relationship quality/stability, and parenting skills.
